codes.name: Taxonomy
codes.textinfo: These different categories present the essential elements to describe and represent interactive scenarios.

children.name: composition
children.textinfo: Key categories that describe the main structure of a figure.

children.name: point of view
children.textinfo: What is the point of view of the figure? Where is the camera?

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: 1st person
children.textinfo: The point of view of the scene is through the eyes of the user.

children.name: 3rd person
children.textinfo: The point of view of the scene is in front of or from one side of the user.

children.name: overshoulder 3/4
children.textinfo: The point of view of the scene if from the back of the user, usually palying with perspective.

children.name: top
children.textinfo: The point of view of the scene is from the top.

children.name: UI only
children.textinfo: The illustration is only conposed of the UI, there is no 3D scene. The point of view is always TOP making the UI in the camera plan. We can admit representations of fingers and hands.

children.name: layout
children.textinfo: How is organized the figure?

children.name: number of frames
children.textinfo: Number of frames composing the illustrations. From 1 to N.

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: one frame
children.textinfo: Figure is structured with one frame.

children.name: multi frames
children.textinfo: Figure is structured with multiple frames.

children.name: sub-framing
children.textinfo: Frames that are included in the frame space and do not belong the represented scene itself.

children.name: inset (PiP)
children.textinfo: A frame is included is another frame's space with a different point of view.

children.name: magnification lense
children.textinfo: A frame (whatever its nature) is included is another frame's space. This inclusion does not belong to the scene, and does represent something in the scene and has been made to help the reader understand the figure.

children.name: UI embedded
children.textinfo: The UI is embedded in the 3D scene, possibly using perspective.

children.name: UI overlay
children.textinfo: The UI has been added on top of the scene. Mostly used to illustrate the user view from a AR system.

children.name: side-by-side
children.textinfo: The frame is composed of multiple sub-frames in a side-by-side disposition. (vertical/horizontal)

children.name: visual characteristics
children.textinfo: Key visual characteristics that compose an illustration.

children.name: type
children.textinfo: The different types of elements that compose a figure.

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: drawing
children.textinfo: The element is a drawn object (representation of a person, a smartphone, a computer, a room, etc. ).

children.name: realism
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: simplistic
children.textinfo: Very simplistic drawings are used.

children.name: realistic
children.textinfo: Drawings are close to the reality.

children.name: UI
children.textinfo: The element is a UI

children.name: drawing
children.textinfo: The UI has been drawn (by hand or not).

children.name: rendering
children.textinfo: The UI has been generated or captured.

children.name: photo
children.textinfo: The element is a photography

children.name: data visualization
children.textinfo: The element represents data through a diagram, a graph, a chart, etc.

children.name: clipart/icon
children.textinfo: The figure contains some cliparts or icons.

children.name: text
children.textinfo: The figure contains some text to describe some elements.

children.name: color
children.textinfo: The color used in the figure.

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: transparency
children.textinfo: Has transparency has been used?

children.name: hue
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: colors
children.textinfo: The figure used multiple colors.

children.name: grayscale
children.textinfo: The figure is based on a grayscale

children.name: monochrome
children.textinfo: The figure is only based on 2 colors : a light and dark color (mostly black and white).

children.name: line style
children.textinfo: What line styles have been used for the different objects?

children.name: dashed
children.textinfo: Dashed lines have been used.

children.name: width
children.textinfo: Lines with different width are used.

children.name: Visual techniques
children.textinfo: Visual techniques identified across multiple figures.

children.name: emphasize
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to visually emphasize, highlight specific information in the illustration.

children.name: region
children.textinfo: Emphasize a region of the figure.

children.name: color area
children.textinfo: Enphasize a region of the figure by apply a specific color in the pointed area.

children.name: element
children.textinfo: Emphasize a element of the figure.

children.name: arrows
children.textinfo: Arrows have been used to focus on element, mostly by pointing from the outside to the object itself.

children.name: color highlight
children.textinfo: A specific color has been used to highlight a specific object.

children.name: enclosing
children.textinfo: The focus element is enclosed.

children.name: exact contour line
children.textinfo: The exact contours of a specific object have been highlighted using a specific line style.

children.name: circle / square
children.textinfo: A circle/rectangle shape has been drawn around the focused object.

children.name: background
children.textinfo: Strategy used to emphasize the element in the foreground from the background

children.name: grayed out / blurred
children.textinfo: A blur effect or a specific color with transparency has been applied to the background.

children.name: removed
children.textinfo: the highlighted objects have been detoured and the background has been removed.

children.name: anonymization
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to anonymize specific element in the figure (e.g. users).

children.name: blur
children.textinfo: Parts of the figure are blurred to not be recognized.

children.name: filling
children.textinfo: Parts of the figure are filled with color to not be recognized.

children.name: grouping and linking
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to link/group elements between each others or with extra information outside the figure (e.g. Definitions).

children.name: color grouping
children.textinfo: Linking/Grouping of elements is made using colors.

children.name: identifiers grouping
children.textinfo: Linking/Grouping of elements is made using identifiers (numbers or letters). Line can be used between the identifier and the element.

children.name: grouping lines
children.textinfo: Lines or Arrows used to link/group multiple elements inside the figure or extra information outside the figure.

children.name: text annotation
children.textinfo: Text attached to an element of a figure (e.g. label, definition) using lines or arrows.

children.name: dynamic
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to describe dynamic content on a static support.

children.name: effects
children.textinfo: Dynamic style effects

children.name: stroboscopic
children.textinfo: A stroboscopic effect is used to show the different steps of the motion.

children.name: waves
children.textinfo: Waves are used to show that an element is hitting another element.

children.name: motion blur
children.textinfo: Blur effect has been used to illustrate motion. The position of the blur can also indicates the path/direction of the movement.

children.name: lines and arrows
children.textinfo: Geometric shapes are used to help understanding the dynamic illustrated.

children.name: trajectories
children.textinfo: Shows the motion path of a element in the figure from the beginning to the end.

children.name: direction
children.textinfo: Shows the direction of the motion.

children.name: transfer
children.textinfo: Shows transition between two states of a model, system.

children.name: projection
children.textinfo: Shows the corresponding projection of an object

children.name: Contact shapes
children.textinfo: Geometric shapes, such as circles, used to represent the region of contact between two elements.

children.name: structure
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to structure an illustration

children.name: identifiers
children.textinfo: Strategies used to identify, order, different part of the same figure.

children.name: numbers
children.textinfo: Numbers are used (often in a corner) to order the sequence of frames or the different parts of a figure.

children.name: letters
children.textinfo: Letters are used (often in a corner) to order the sequence of frames or the different parts of a figure.

children.name: title
children.textinfo: A different title is used to annotate the sub frames.

children.name: measure
children.textinfo: Visual techniques used to illustrate physical units.

children.name: Arrows
children.textinfo: Arrows are used to indicate angles, physical dimensions.

children.name: Text indicator
children.textinfo: Text may simply used to directly show physical dimensions.

children.name: interactive Scenario
children.textinfo: Key elements of an interactive scenario.

children.name: purpose
children.textinfo: What is the purpose of the figure?

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: design space
children.textinfo: The figure shows a design space, i.e. a set of functionalities, possibilities, commands, use cases available in a system. Figures are usually composed of multiple **independent** frames.

children.name: interaction sequence
children.textinfo: The figure shows an interaction sequence (aka storyboard), i.e. a sequence of actions that must be accomplished in a specific order to launch a system command. Figures are usally composed of multiple **dependent** frames.

children.name: interactive system
children.textinfo: The figure shows the setup, the system but the interaction between the user and the system is not represented. It is basically a focus on the system itself.

children.name: time
children.textinfo: How time is represented in the figure?

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: moving
children.textinfo: Time is evolving accross the figure, i.e. we can see a transition, progression, within the user's actions and/or the system's responses.

children.name: still
children.textinfo: we are observing the user and/or the system at a specific moment without any information on the next/previous user's actions or system's responses.

children.name: activity
children.textinfo: What are the users doing with the system?.

children.name: production
children.textinfo: digital content production: programming, text entry

children.name: entertainment
children.textinfo: video, music, video games

children.name: 2D/3D creation
children.textinfo: 2D drawing, 3D modeling, photoshop, illustrator, svg

children.name: fabrication
children.textinfo: physical fabrication

children.name: communication
children.textinfo: communication or exchange between the users

children.name: data manipulation
children.textinfo: maps, charts, numbers

children.name: Users
children.textinfo: How are users represented in the figure?

children.name: number
children.textinfo: The number of users involved in the interaction.

children.name: Solo-user
children.textinfo: Only one user is interacting with the system.

children.name: Multi-users
children.textinfo: Multiple users are interacting with the system

children.name: body part
children.textinfo: Which parts of the Human body are represented?

children.name: Specific part
children.textinfo: A focus is made on a specific part of the body.

children.name: hand
children.textinfo: A focus is espacially made on user's hands. Nothing else if visible.

children.name: fingers
children.textinfo: A focus is especially made on user's fingers. Nothing else is visible.

children.name: head
children.textinfo: A focus is especially made on the user's head. Nothing else is visible.

children.name: foot
children.textinfo: A focus is especially made on the user's foot. Nothing else is visible.

children.name: lower body
children.textinfo: Mose of the lower body (legs and feet) is visible.

children.name: upper body
children.textinfo: Most of the upper body (torso and arms) is visible

children.name: full body
children.textinfo: Most of the body is visible.

children.name: Interactive system
children.textinfo: Key elements describing an interactive system.

children.name: action
children.textinfo: How is the user action?

children.name: discrete
children.textinfo: User's actions are really quick and brief over the time.

children.name: Pointing
children.textinfo: User is pointing at a target.

children.name: Key press
children.textinfo: User is pressing a button.

children.name: Symbolic gesture
children.textinfo: User is performing a symbolic gesture.

children.name: continuous
children.textinfo: The user is continuously interacting with the system.

children.name: translating
children.textinfo: User is translating an object.

children.name: rotating
children.textinfo: User is rotating an object.

children.name: scaling
children.textinfo: User is scaling an object.

children.name: scrolling
children.textinfo: User is scrolling a view.

children.name: deforming
children.textinfo: User is deforming [a part of] the system.

children.name: Interaction type
children.textinfo: What is the type of interaction involved?

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: touch interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction relying on a touch sensitive surface.

children.name: mid-air interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction is made is the air. The system may involved controllers, tracking.

children.name: distal interaction
children.textinfo: Directly interacting with objects from a distance (through intermediate devices or not).

children.name: on body interaction
children.textinfo: The interactive system is on the Human body.

children.name: computer interaction
children.textinfo: Classic computer interaction (meaning keyboard/touchpad/mouse).

children.name: tangible interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction with the system is made though tangible objects.

children.name: controllers interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction with the system is made with controllers. (joysticks, tv remotes)

children.name: pen interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction with the system is made with a pen.

children.name: gaze interaction
children.textinfo: Interaction with the system is made with the eyes.

children.name: input channel
children.textinfo: How is the user actually interacting with the system.

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: tracking based
children.textinfo: User is tracked by the system.

children.name: outside in
children.textinfo: User is tracked by the system with external sensors.

children.name: inside out
children.textinfo: User is tracked by the system with sensors on / inside him.

children.name: device based
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system through a manipulable device.

children.name: mobile devices
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system by using a mobile device: smartphones, tablets, smartwatches, etc.

children.name: large surfaces
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system though big screens: screen on a wall, touch table, tv, etc.

children.name: desktop devices
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system through desktop devices: mouse, keyboad, touchpad on a desk, etc.

children.name: laptop devices
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system through laptop devices: integrated keyboad, integrated touchpad, etc.

children.name: controllers
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system using a controllers: tv remote, game controller, joystick, etc.

children.name: tangible objects
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: AR
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: VR
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: sound based
children.textinfo: The system is listening to the sounds emitted by the user

children.name: speech input
children.textinfo: The user is interacting with the system by speaking through a microphone

children.name: output modality
children.textinfo: Not specified

children.name: ___ignore___
children.textinfo: Fake code allowing to force the indicator to be green

children.name: haptic
children.textinfo: There is an haptic response from the system.

children.name: visual
children.textinfo: Response from the system involves a screen, a display.

children.name: large displays
children.textinfo: Visual feedback through large displays: : tv, wall screen, touchtable

children.name: computer displays
children.textinfo: Visual feedback through computer screens : laptop, desktop, car embedded display

children.name: mobile displays
children.textinfo: Visual feedback through mobile displays: smartphones, tablets, smartwatches

children.name: projected displays
children.textinfo: Visual feedback through a projected image on a surface

children.name: head mounted displays
children.textinfo: AR, VR displays

children.name: lights
children.textinfo: lamps, leds, any bulbs

children.name: audible
children.textinfo: The response from the system is audible.

children.name: sound based
children.textinfo: The system emits specific sounds.

children.name: speech output
children.textinfo: The system speaks to the user in his language.

children.name: Situation
children.textinfo: Where does the interaction take place?

children.name: Desktop
children.textinfo: On a classic desk/table (Mostly involving desktop computers, keyboard, mouse etc.)

children.name: Public/private transport
children.textinfo: In a car, bus, plane, on a bike, etc.

children.name: Outdoors
children.textinfo: Park, streets

children.name: Private indoors
children.textinfo: At the office, at work, at home, etc.

children.name: Public indoors
children.textinfo: Malls, stations, museums, at gym. Might involve a crowded place
